title: Scenario 3: Solo Mode Tab-Specific Visibility
content:
Issue #47 Scenario 3: Solo Mode (Pin to Specific Tab)

**Purpose:** Verify Solo mode functionality where a Quick Tab appears only on designated browser tab(s), not globally.

**Test Location:** tests/extension/issue-47-scenarios.spec.js

**Key Test Steps:**
1. Create Quick Tab in global mode
2. Toggle Solo mode for Quick Tab
3. Verify Quick Tab only visible on current tab
4. Switch to second tab - verify Quick Tab hidden
5. Switch back to first tab - verify Quick Tab visible
6. Unsolo - verify Quick Tab becomes global again

**Test Bridge Methods Used:**
- createQuickTab(url)
- getQuickTabs()
- toggleSolo(id, tabId) - NEW METHOD
- getVisibilityState(tabId) - NEW METHOD

**Expected Behavior:**
- Solo mode restricts Quick Tab to specific tab
- Quick Tab hidden on all other tabs
- Unsolo restores global visibility
- Solo button state indicator changes (ðŸŽ¯ when active)

**Implementation Status:** âœ… Implemented with new test bridge methods

**Test Pattern:**
```javascript
await helper1.createQuickTab('https://github.com');
const tabs = await helper1.getQuickTabs();

await helper1.toggleSolo(tabs[0].id);
const visState = await helper1.getVisibilityState();
expect(visState.success).toBe(true);

// On second tab, Quick Tab should not appear
const tabs2 = await helper2.getQuickTabs();
// Verify solo Quick Tab not in global list
```

**Dependencies:** Solo/mute state manager, visibility controller
